examples.text: When I told you to ‘get lost’ I didn't expect to **be taken literally**.
Idioms usually cannot be translated literally into another language.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the truth of something that may seem surprising

examples.text: There are literally hundreds of prizes to win.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a word or phrase, even if it is not actually true in a literal sense

examples.text: I literally jumped out of my skin.
